name: Bill's Lasagna
label: Italian
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Cook beef and pork until no longer pink, about 6 minutes. Drain excess fat.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Add marinara sauce and 1 teaspoon salt. Simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
In a medium pot over medium heat, warm milk without boiling.
In a separate pot, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flour and cook, whisking constantly, until light tan in color, about 2 minutes.
Slowly whisk in warm milk. Cook, whisking constantly, until sauce thickens, about 3-5 minutes. Stir in nutmeg, salt, and black pepper.
Preheat oven to 350°F. In a 9x13-inch baking dish, spread 1.5 cups Bolognese sauce. Add 3 pasta sheets and 3/4 cup béchamel sauce.
Sprinkle with mozzarella and Parmesan. Repeat for 5 layers, finishing with cheese on top.
Cover with greased foil and bake for 20 minutes. Increase oven temperature to 400°F and bake uncovered for 25-30 minutes until bubbly.
Broil on medium for 1 minute until the top is browned. Let cool for 15 minutes. Top with fresh parsley and serve.
